3Dfunctiongrapher module¶

3Dfunctiongrapher.funcprocess(function)[source]¶

Checks the raw function string for malicious code

Parameters:function – Raw function input from tkinter.Text() box
3Dfunctiongrapher.github_open()[source]¶

Opens new tab in browser and directs user to GitHub repository

3Dfunctiongrapher.grapher(func, graphtype, xmin, xmax, xscale, ymin, ymax, yscale, zmin, zmax, zscale)[source]¶

Uses the processed variables to graph the function

Parameters:
  • func – Processed function string
  • graphtype – Graphtype value from tkinter.Radiobutton()
  • xmin – X-axis minimum
  • xmax – X-axis maximum
  • xscale – X-axis step
  • ymin – Y-axis minimum
  • ymax – Y-axis maximum
  • yscale – Y-axis step
  • zmin – Z-axis minimum
  • zmax – Z-axis maximum
  • zscale – Z-axis step
3Dfunctiongrapher.main()[source]¶

Uses window_process(), funcprocess(), and grapher() to take the inputs and use the grapher to graph the inputted function in the specified window

3Dfunctiongrapher.quitfunc()[source]¶

Closes Tk window

3Dfunctiongrapher.savegraph()[source]¶

Saves the graph as an image, savenumber is used as global var to allow increment after each save

3Dfunctiongrapher.window_process(raw_input)[source]¶

Takes the variables and converts them to floats, will raise an error if non-numerical values are entered

Parameters:raw_input – Raw input from tkinter.Entry() boxes
